title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message:
board power on with fan spin high. no picture.


i looked entire board and this R1102 area has corrosion.
[IMG type="full" width="200px"]http://i64.tinypic.com/nfscaw.jpg[/IMG]
 


cleaned up, found broken trace and a test point.
[IMG type="full" width="200px"]http://i65.tinypic.com/2zsz0d1.jpg[/IMG]
 

that trace is broken and no longer connected to pin1 of R1102. that trace is PP1V05_S0.

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message:
1. Did you fix the trace?
2. Is it shorted or does it have a really low resistance to ground?

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message:
i havent fix. pin1 of R1102 is not shorted to ground 

i just checked it is really low resistance (18Ω) to ground (meter beep)

what i need to do next?

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message: L7630 has continuity to ground. should i remove L7630 if is still shorted to ground?

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message: I don't think you have a short (18ohm is not a short). Fix the trace and see if this fixes it.

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message:
noice. that has fixed. it booted to (?) folder.

thanks [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/member/547-rvanpruissen"]rvanpruissen[/URL] for your help

[IMG type="full" width="200px"]http://i63.tinypic.com/2duba0n.jpg[/IMG]

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message:
now i need to fix someone else cockups :(

broken wfi cables and a broken screw left in there...



[IMG type="full" width="200px"]http://i65.tinypic.com/wi2get.jpg[/IMG]
 
[IMG type="full" width="200px"]http://i68.tinypic.com/qn37s2.jpg[/IMG]

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message: I don't know about the WiFi cables and would appreciate a good tip on this too :) I would try to release the screw with a sharp screwdriver. Maybe even with tweezers...

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message: it is a hole almost flat. i will try drill it in using a dremel.

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message: Splice wifi cables together from a donor LCD. Keep the core and shielding short(3mm), this is 2-5GHz!

title: 820-3208 - PP1V05_S0 Shorted to GND
message:
done. i taken from a broken test display. i'll test everything tomorrow when a new replacement keyboard arrive.
